newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ shares end slightly down on inflated turnover.
newsitem.headline: NZ shares end slightly down on inflated turnover.

text.p: * New Zealand share prices end slightly lower
* Turnover inflated by trade in Tenz, Lion, CHH
* Pulp and paper returns to favour. Telecom sheds 10 cents
280 +8 * NZSE-10 cap index -3.74 at 1,176.11 344 -6 * Volume NZ$82 million. Futures -3 at 1,180
New Zealand share prices ended slightly lower on Tuesday on turnover inflated by activity in the Tenz fund, Lion Nathan and Carter Holt Harvey.
The NZSE-40 Capital Index ended 3.60 points down at 2,357.57 on turnover worth NZ$84 million.
The Tenz fund was responsible for almost NZ$15.4 million of the total, with several trades done through Cavill White Securities.
Lion Nathan was also actively traded, with stock worth NZ$13.22 million going through, much of it through SBC Warburg.
Lion ended six cents down at NZ$3.44.
Pulp and paper enjoyed a return to favour after losing ground last week. FCL Paper gained eight cents to NZ$2.80 and Carter Holt Harvey rose two to $3.41.

The main mover on the day was Telecom, down 10 cents at NZ$7.30. Tim Snedden at ANZ Securities said weakness may have been allied to concerns about the New Zealand dollar, should a centre left coalition become the government.
New Zealand First, which holds the balance of power, is expected to make an announcement at 5 p.m. (0400 GMT) on the timing and form of a coalition announcement.
